ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! You do not honour orphans
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: No. In fact you are not generous to the orphans,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But no; you do not treat the orphan honourably,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Since wealth does not necessarily guarantee everlasting happiness) then why do you not show kindness to the orphans,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Not at all – but rather you do not honour the orphan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But no! But you treat not the orphans with kindness and generosity!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! but you do not honor the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No indeed; but you honour not the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but ye (for your part) honour not the orphan
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: No indeed, but you show no kindness to the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! But ye honour not the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No indeed! No, you do not honour the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nay, nay! but ye honour not the orphans!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay! But you treat not the orphans with kindness and generosity (i.e. you neither treat them well, nor give them their exact right of inheritance)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No! But you show no good to the orphan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Not at all. But you do not honor the orphan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! But you do not honor the orphan
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [89:17] No indeed! — a disavowal [of this notion], in other words, honour is not about wealth, nor is there any humiliation in poverty, rather it has to do with obedience and disobedience [respectively]; but the disbelievers of Mecca unmindful of this. Rather they do not honour the orphan, they do not treat him with   kindness, despite their wealth, or [it means that] they do not give him what is his due from an inheritance,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay) this is a reply to them: No, but the honour I bestow is due to My acknowledgment of some My servants and the success I give to them, while My despising is because I turn away from some servants and completely forsake them, (but ye (for your part) honour not the orphan) you do not acknowledge the right of the orphan when he is under your care.
